rules: Rule1: Whenever data are analyzed, the treatment is approved.
Rule2: Either the data are analyzed or the doctor reviewed.
Rule3: Provided that the doctor reviewed, consent was signed.
Rule4: In the event the drug was administered, the patient was monitored.
Rule5: Either the drug was administered or the doctor prescribed.
Rule6: When the doctor prescribed, then, provided consent was signed, the treatment was approved.
Rule7: If the patient was monitored, then, under the condition that consent was signed, the treatment was approved.
Rule8: If the patient was enrolled, then, when the patient is not compliant, the patient is excluded.
Rule9: Whenever a patient withdrew, the trial was completed.
Rule10: Either the device is functioning or it was calibrated.
Rule11: When the patient was screened, then, if the patient is eligible, and provided the patient was not enrolled, the patient withdrew.
Rule12: Either the patient was screened or the patient was recruited.
Rule13: Under the condition that the patient was recruited, then, when the patient is eligible, and if the patient was not enrolled, the patient withdrew.
Rule14: When a group was assigned, then, if the patient is eligible, and under the condition the patient was not enrolled, the patient withdrew.
Rule15: Provided treatment was received, then, in the event the patient was randomized, a group was assigned.
Rule16: If the patient improved, then treatment was received.
Rule17: Either the patient improved or the patient stabilized.
Rule18: If the device was calibrated, then the patient is compliant.
Rule19: Whenever results were reported, they were published.
Rule20: When protocol was violated, data were excluded.
Rule21: Either results are biased or, in the event protocol was violated, data are not excluded.
Rule22: Either statistics were analyzed or data were verified.
Rule23: Under the condition that data were verified, results are not biased.
Rule24: Provided quality was checked, results are valid.
Rule25: When ethics were reviewed, then, if statistics were analyzed, quality was checked.
Rule26: If the patient dropped, then, in the event the patient was not enrolled, the patient withdrew.
Rule27: Either the patient dropped or treatment was discontinued.
Rule28: If treatment was discontinued, then the study was terminated.
Rule29: Under the condition that criteria were met, the regulator approved.

Rule30: When standards were failed, then, if the trial was audited, and provided it is not the case that if the study was terminated then when the patient was not enrolled the patient withdrew, the issue was investigated.
Rule31: Provided the journal accepted, then, when the report was submitted, either criteria were met or standards were failed.
Rule32: Either the journal accepted or the paper was rejected.
Rule33: When the paper was rejected, then, under the condition the report was submitted, either criteria were met or standards were failed.
Rule34: If the device malfunctioned, then the data are not reliable.
Rule35: Provided data were corrupted, the data are not reliable.
Rule36: When data were collected, then either the device malfunctioned or data were corrupted.
Rule37: If the treatment was approved, then the patient is compliant.
Rule38: If it is not the case that when the device is functioning it monitors the patient, then the data are reliable.
Rule39: Under the condition it is not the case that provided it is not the case that if the patient stabilized then treatment was received, results are inconclusive, results were reported.
Rule40: Whenever it is not the case that if it is not the case that when the patient stabilized treatment was received then results are inconclusive, results are not published.
Rule41: If it is not the case that when the patient was not enrolled the patient withdrew, protocol was violated.
Rule42: If data were not collected, then data were lost.
Rule43: If the patient is not compliant, then the patient is not excluded.
facts: Fact6: It is not the case that the device monitors the patient.
Fact7: The trial was not completed.
Fact10: The issue was not investigated.
Fact11: The regulator did not approve.
